review: I purchased Google Chromecast for $30 at BestBuy in December.  While it is a good product I have a two issues:- Picture does not to seem to be as high-res as Roku- No physical remoteThe no physical remote is why I ended up getting a Roku3 and using the Chromecast on my basement TV.  I didn't realize how much this would annoy me.  With Netflix there are no commercials to FFW through,  so why would I need a physical remote?  Simple answer,  it is a royal PITA to have to open up my phone if I need to pause or rewind the streamed content.

review: Plenty of the more useful reviews on this will be better than mine, but the one thing I would suggest is missing is the ability to use your mobile's signal to stream over a non-internet wifi network to the TV.  I had a 4 week period with no cable and no internet but had a wifi signal at my house and discovered that i had to sit and watch my phone while my 50" TV sat idly by.  Only a small caveat, but this would be nice from my perspective.  I could then only have a phone internet plan, then get HBO/Netflix through my TV which is all I watch.
